info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central McDowell, southeastern Madison, northeastern Buncombe and southern Yancey Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Downtown Asheville, or near Weaverville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Marshall, Downtown Asheville, North Asheville, Woodfin, Weaverville, Mars Hill, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens and B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
